title: Were black soldiers segregated in the battlefield after Jim Crow? - Quora
tags: History of the United States of America

response.answer_text: Yes, even before Jim Crow. In the Revolutionary War, the Continental Army & Navy was integrated. The 54th Massachusetts Volunteer Regiment started recruiting African-Americans in Feb 1863. Later that year the US Colored Troops were raised. A black private was paid $13 per month. White US Army privates were paid $16. Jim Crow became the law of the land after Plessy vs Ferguson in 1896. Pres. Truman had earlier integrated the US Armed Forces in 1947. He heard newspaper reports of black WW2 veterans being thrown off trucks. Jim Crow ended in 1964.
